content.question: A non-linear spring that is neither compressed or stretched, is connected at one end to a wall and the other end is connected to a block as shown. The magnitude of the force <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> required to compress the spring can be described by the equation <math alttext="F of x equals e raised to the k x power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>F</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>e</mi><mrow><mi>k</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi></math> is the spring constant, and <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> is the distance the spring is compressed or stretched from equilibrium. The block is pushed along the surface toward the wall compressing the spring a distance <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math>. What is the change in potential energy of the block-spring system because of the compression of the spring?

choices.label: <math alttext="one half k, open parenthesis, D, close parenthesis, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>k</mi><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>D</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="e raised to the k D power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msup><mi>e</mi><mrow><mi>k</mi><mi>D</mi></mrow></msup></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="negative k e raised to the k D power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>âˆ’</mo><mi>k</mi><msup><mi>e</mi><mrow><mi>k</mi><mi>D</mi></mrow></msup></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 1 over k, end fraction, open parenthesis, e raised to the k D power minus 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>k</mi></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mi>e</mi><mrow><mi>k</mi><mi>D</mi></mrow></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction 1 over k, end fraction, open parenthesis, e raised to the k D power minus 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>k</mi></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mi>e</mi><mrow><mi>k</mi><mi>D</mi></mrow></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
